title: Highest Short-term Debt Relative to Exports
description: In 2023, Lebanon's short-term debt was 135.71% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income, indicating a significant reliance on external financing.

title: Largest Net ODA Received Relative to Capital Formation
description: In 2022, Lebanon received net official development assistance amounting to 554.48% of its gross capital formation, highlighting substantial foreign aid dependency.

title: Lowest PM2.5 Pollution Exposure
description: In 2017, only a negligible portion of Lebanon's population was exposed to PM2.5 pollution levels exceeding WHO's Interim Target-1 value, showcasing effective air quality management.

title: Highest Household Consumption Expenditure Relative to GDP
description: In 2022, household and NPISHs final consumption expenditure accounted for 140.38% of Lebanon's GDP, reflecting a consumption-driven economy.

title: Lowest Private Sector Capital Formation
description: In 2022, Lebanon's gross fixed capital formation in the private sector was just 1.17% of GDP, indicating minimal private investment.

title: Sharp Decline in Gross Fixed Capital Formation
description: Lebanon experienced an 88.59% decline in gross fixed capital formation in 2022, reflecting severe economic contraction.

title: Lowest Gross Fixed Capital Formation Relative to GDP
description: In 2022, Lebanon's gross fixed capital formation was only 1.23% of GDP, highlighting limited investment in fixed assets.

title: Steep Decline in Gross Capital Formation
description: In 2022, Lebanon's gross capital formation plummeted by 95.58%, indicating a drastic reduction in investment activities.

title: Lowest Gross Capital Formation Relative to GDP
description: Lebanon's gross capital formation was merely 1.23% of GDP in 2022, underscoring a significant investment shortfall.

title: Lowest Industry Value Added Relative to GDP
description: In 2022, the industry sector, including construction, contributed only 2.39% to Lebanon's GDP, indicating a weak industrial base.

title: Negative Gross Domestic Savings
description: Lebanon recorded a gross domestic savings of -252.28 trillion LCU in 2022, reflecting a severe savings deficit.

title: Negative Gross Savings in US Dollars
description: In 2022, Lebanon's gross savings were -4.41 billion USD, indicating a significant financial imbalance.

title: Negative Gross Savings in Local Currency
description: Lebanon's gross savings amounted to -120.46 trillion LCU in 2022, highlighting a critical economic challenge.

title: Lowest Gross Savings Relative to GNI
description: In 2022, Lebanon's gross savings were -21.88% of GNI, indicating a substantial savings deficit.

title: Lowest Gross Savings Relative to GDP
description: Lebanon's gross savings were -21.01% of GDP in 2022, reflecting a severe lack of financial reserves.

title: Significant Refugee Population
description: In 2023, Lebanon hosted 490,636 refugees under the UNRWA mandate, highlighting its role as a major refugee host country.
